title: As a support main I can't stand playing with a Kalista
body: Don't get me wrong I enjoy her kit and find it refreshing with her abilities, but if i'm  playing solo Q with a Kalista the ults are almost always poorly timed. Nah i didnt wanna CC them Kalista just ult me instead to find out im not in range to hit them. Maybe its the weird windup the ult has that throws me off. Shes a great duo Q champ but I almost find myself wanting to dodge a game where shes my ADC. Thoughts?

replies.body:
have to confess I don't 'get' her yet. I don't know why riot bother with such fancy %%%% when when most players haven't  learned the old champs yet.
First game I played supping a kalista i swear her ulti threw me under the enemy turret more than once. I had no idea what was happening, and still don't.
If Kalista is adc I don't sup, simple

> have to confess I don't 'get' her yet. I don't know why riot bother with such fancy %%%% when when most players haven't  learned the old champs yet.
> First game I played supping a kalista i swear her ulti threw me under the enemy turret more than once. I had no idea what was happening, and still don't.
> If Kalista is adc I don't sup, simple

That was your fault then. She uts you but you choose where the ult lands. Hell you could even troll and get thrown away from kalista and let her die
Basically this. Kalista chooses when to ult initially but after that you have four seconds to choose which direction to get thrown in, otherwise you just go whichever direction she is facing.

I personally love kalista and while i dont play adc, im glad there is a champ that forces teamwork on people, at the moment there are too many champs like akali and kat ect. who are a team all by themselves, champs that perform better or worse becasue of other player's decisions are great for enforcing teamwork.
a good step forward was yasuo and his ult, lots of people were sceptical about it at first but it improved teamwork so much, and now most games when i pick yasuo, at least one other person on the team changes their champion to one with a nock up which is nice to see in our usually self centred community, and kalista is great because bot lane is where most of the verbal stuff happens its either "OMG this leona is God :D honour after game man" or 
"WTF ashe why u keep feeding them omg gg surrender you are dragging me down, reported" but with kalista, you cant get mad at your supp and your supp cant get mad at you seeming you need both of you to work your ult, it cuts down on the toxicity of the lane that has the most toxic and most friendly behavior.

so instead of dodging, use her to better both yourself and the kalista player :)
and with the poorly timed ults, she is only 2 weeks old so people are not used to it yet.

I don't like being a support to a kalista either :/ I like to play squishy supports that don't have synergy with her at all. I much prefer it if the kalista decides to make a pact the the jungler instead of me (maybe you could suggest this to the kaslistas).

Well it depends on the support you're using on whether it's better for them to bind to you or the jungler. Ranged supports, even squishier ones, can still be a better option for binding since they can help proc her W passive and her ult puts them at max attack range from enemies that are hit (and can actually be used to help the sup escape, I do this a lot). But generally if you're not prepared to take on the responsibility you should ask the Kal to bind to the jungler rather than you as you suggested (they might not but it's worth a shot). As I mentioned though, she is very teamwork orientated and not an ideal champ for solo q.

As somewhat of a Kalista main I understand your pain. Kal is a very teamwork orientated champ and when you're match with randoms there's not much teamwork to be had. At the moment it seems a lot of people are still getting used to how she works, which is probably why they've not been in range when they've ulted. Unfortunately there's not much you can do to avoid it short of dodging.

> Kalista is a horrible champion.

She's far from a horrible champion. The mobility as damage she can do is quite high. Her ult is just disoreinting if you're not duo bot.
Once you hit an elo where bot lanes know how to harass that's when Kalista becomes garbage tier and should never be picked.

"OMG I WANTED YOU TO JUMP THE OTHER ONE" - the first Kalista I ever played with.
She had never heard of targeting pings?
To be honest, I am good with her, but only play her when I play with friends for ult coordination over voice chat.
As a support main I know your pain though. The influx of them is annoying, so I have just been playing top and mid a lot lately :\.
